title: R Implementation of Water Balance Model Abimo
text: details install KWB-R packages checkout installation tutorial.
code: ### Optionally: specify GitHub Personal Access Token (GITHUB_PAT) ### See here why this might be important for you: ### https://kwb-r.github.io/kwb.pkgbuild/articles/install.html#set-your-github_pat  # Sys.setenv(GITHUB_PAT = "mysecret_access_token")  # Install package "remotes" from CRAN if (! require("remotes")) {   install.packages("remotes", repos = "https://cloud.r-project.org") }  # Install KWB package 'kwb.rabimo' from GitHub remotes::install_github("KWB-R/kwb.rabimo")

what: Call a Function with Argument Combinations from a Data Frame — call_with_data
title: Call a Function with Argument Combinations from a Data Frame — call_with_data
text: Call Function Argument Combinations Data Frame

title: Call a Function with Argument Combinations from a Data Frame — call_with_data
code: call_with_data(   FUN,   data,   ...,   threshold = 0.5,   SIMPLIFY = TRUE,   USE.NAMES = TRUE )

title: Call a Function with Argument Combinations from a Data Frame — call_with_data
text: FUN function called data data frame one column per argument FUN ... (constant) arguments FUN passed mapply via MoreArgs threshold ratio unique value combinations relevant columns data value combinations columns threshold value FUN called unique value combinations. increase performance. SIMPLIFY passed tomapply, default: TRUE USE.NAMES passed tomapply, default: TRUE

title: Call a Function with Argument Combinations from a Data Frame — call_with_data
text: vector length nrow(data) result values returned FUN

title: Call a Function with Argument Combinations from a Data Frame — call_with_data
code: combis <- expand.grid(x = 1:2, y = c(10, 20, 30)) combis #>   x  y #> 1 1 10 #> 2 2 10 #> 3 1 20 #> 4 2 20 #> 5 1 30 #> 6 2 30  call_with_data(`+`, combis) #> -> Calling +() for all 6 value combinations ... ok. (0.00 secs)  #> [1] 11 12 21 22 31 32

title: Provide Data on Potential Evaporation — getPotentialEvaporation
Provide Data on Potential Evaporation — getPotentialEvaporation
text: isWaterbody (vector ) logical indicating whether block area type (type/yield/irrigation tuple) "waterbody" district (vector ) integer indicating district number plot area (original input column "BEZIRK") lookup data frame key columns isWaterbody, district value columns etp, etps. data frame required structure returned abimo_config_to_config list element "potentialEvaporation"

title: Provide Data on Potential Evaporation — getPotentialEvaporation
code: if (FALSE) { config <- abimo_config_to_config(kwb.abimo:::read_config()) getPotentialEvaporation(   is_waterbody = TRUE,   district = 1,   lookup = config$potentialEvaporation ) }

text: Convert List Similar Flat Sublists Data Frame

title: Convert List of Similar Flat Sublists to a Data Frame — list_to_data_frame_with_keys
Convert List of Similar Flat Sublists to a Data Frame — list_to_data_frame_with_keys
text: x list similar flat lists, .e. lists list elements names list elements length one key_name name column returned data frame contain integer values constructed element names x key_pattern regular expression matching element names x. expression must contain one pair parentheses enclosing part used key, e.g. "element_([0-9]+)" convert function applied (character) key. Set e.g. convert = .integer generate integer keys. Default: identity

title: Convert List of Similar Flat Sublists to a Data Frame — list_to_data_frame_with_keys
text: data frame keys column named according key_name value columns according list elements sublists x

title: Convert List of Similar Flat Sublists to a Data Frame — list_to_data_frame_with_keys
code: list_to_data_frame_with_keys(   x = list(     element_1 = list(a = 100, b = 10),     element_2 = list(a = 200, b = 20)   ),   key_name = "element",   key_pattern = "element_([0-9]+)",   convert = as.integer ) #>   element   a  b #> 1       1 100 10 #> 2       2 200 20
